lines.content: * Represents a parser to find the command for the input. A Parser object corresponds to

* Returns the command corresponds to the user input
* If the command is unclear, PikaChuException is threw
* @param fullCommand the full input from user.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If cannot find the corresponding command.
public static Command parse(String fullCommand) throws PikachuException {

* an exception threw by Pikachu task manager bot.
* Throw exception with that string as the error message.

* @throws PikachuException If anything unexpected happen (e,g invalid filepath).

* Represents the task list to store all tasks. A TaskList object corresponds to
* a string arraylist containing all tasks.
* Represents the Ui for Pikachu chatbot. A Ui object corresponds to
* Uis needed for Pikachu chatbot to communicate with the user.
private final Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
* Returns the scanner to read next line.
* @return the scanner to read next line.
System.out.println(HORIZON + "Pika Pikachu! (I am Pikachu!)\nPi-ka-chu?(Do you need any help?)\n" + HORIZON);
* Represents command that performs add function to the to do list. A AddCommand object corresponds to
* an instruction to add deadline/event/to do e.g., "event formal dinner /at dinner hall".
* Saves the new task if valid, else throw exception.
* Informs the user about the situation through String output.
* @param tasks Task List of all tasks currently.
* @param ui Ui for user to see.
* @param storage Storage in charge of the current tasks.
* @throws PikachuException If invalid date format for deadline, empty name of the task.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PikachuException {
throw new PikachuException("Need valid date format(yyyy-mm-dd) Pikaaaa");
* Returns whether this function performs an exit action on the task manager.
* Represents abstract command. A Command object corresponds to
* a command key in by user e.g., unmark 2.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PikachuException;
* Represents command that performs delete function. A DeleteCommand object corresponds to
* an instruction to delete tasks e.g., delete 2
* Deletes the task and saves the update to task list if valid, else throw exception.
* Informs the user about the situation through String output.
* @param tasks Task List of all tasks currently.
* @param ui Ui for user to see.
* @param storage Storage in charge of the current tasks.
* @throws PikachuException If invalid format or the index of task out of range.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PikachuException {
throw new PikachuException("Pi-must be numbers behind-pi!");
* Returns whether this function performs an exit action on the task manager.
* Represents command that exits the task manager Pikachu. A ExitCommand object corresponds to
* an instruction to exit task manager Pikachu e.g., bye.
* @param tasks Task List of all tasks currently.
* @param ui Ui for user to see.
* @param storage Storage in charge of the current tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns whether this function performs an exit action on the task manager.
* Represents command that find tasks. A FindCommand object corresponds to
* an instruction to find tasks e.g., bye.
* Executes the find command to find relevant content in task list.
* @param tasks Task list containing all the tasks.
* @param ui User interface of Pikachu task manager.
* @param storage Storage space with functions that update and take out tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns whether to exit for pikachu task manager.
* @return false as this command does not exit the bot.
* Represents command that lists the current task list. A ListCommand object corresponds to
* an instruction to list the current task list e.g., list
* Informs the user about the situation through String output.
* @param tasks Task List of all tasks currently.
* @param ui Ui for user to see.
* @param storage Storage in charge of the current tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns whether this function performs an exit action on the task manager.
* Represents command that marks tasks as completed. A MarkCommand object corresponds to
* an instruction to mark completion by index e.g., mark 2.
* Marks a task as completed, saves the new task if valid, else throw exception.
* Informs the user about the situation through String output.
* @param tasks Task List of all tasks currently.
* @param ui Ui for user to see.
* @param storage Storage in charge of the current tasks.
* @throws PikachuException If invalid format or out of range of the task index.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PikachuException {
throw new PikachuException("Pi-must be numbers behind-pi!");
* Returns whether this function performs an exit action on the task manager.
* Represents command that unmarks tasks as completed. A UnmarkCommand object corresponds to
* an instruction to unmark completion by index e.g., mark 2.
* Marks a task as incomplete, saves the new task if valid, else throw exception.
* Informs the user about the situation through String output.
* @param tasks Task List of all tasks currently.
* @param ui Ui for user to see.
* @param storage Storage in charge of the current tasks.
* @throws PikachuException If invalid format or out of range of the task index.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PikachuException {

* Represents a test to test deadline class objects. A DeadlineTest object corresponds to
* a test for deadline class objects.
* Tests the correctness of name of deadline tasks.
* Tests the correctness of timing of deadline tasks.
* Represents a test to test event class objects. A EventTest object corresponds to
* a test for event class objects.
* Tests the correctness of name of event tasks.
* Tests the correctness of location of event tasks.
* Represents a test to test to-do class objects. A TodoTest object corresponds to
* a test for to-do class objects.
* Tests the correctness of name of to-do tasks.
* Tests the correctness of timing of to-do tasks, which is no timing indicated at all.
